tit.e: Omizo jinya (regional government office of the Omizo Domain)
Omizo jinya (regional government office of the Omizo Domain)
Omizo jinya (regional government office of the Omizo Domain)

sen.j: 大溝陣屋（おおみぞじんや）は滋賀県高島市高島勝野（近江国高島郡）にあった大溝藩の藩庁である。
sen.e: Omizo jinya was a regional government office of the Omizo Domain located in Takashimakatsuno, Takashima City, Shiga Prefecture (Takashima County, Omi Province).
sen.cmt: 高島勝野：高島市勝野という住所はあるようです。（原文ママ訳出としています。）
sen.e: Omizo jinya was a regional government office of the Omizo Domain located in Takashimakatsuno, Takashima City, Shiga Prefecture (Takashima County, Omi Province).
Omizo jinya was a regional government office of the Omizo Domain located in Takashimakatsuno, Takashima City, Shiga Prefecture (Takashima County, Omi Province).
Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 元亀3年織田信長が高島郡を進攻すると、天正7年（1579年）織田信澄が高島郡を領し、明智光秀の縄張りで大溝城が築かれた。
sen.e: After Nobunaga ODA invaded Takashima County in 1572, Nobuzumi ODA governed the county, and the Omizo-jo Castle was built according to the nawabari (castle plan; general term for the layout of a castle and its component structures) developed by Mitsuhide AKECHI.

After Nobunaga ODA invaded Takashima County in 1572, Nobuzumi ODA governed the county, and the Omizo-jo Castle was built according to the nawabari (castle plan; general term for the layout of a castle and its component structures) developed by Mitsuhide AKECHI in 1579.

After Nobunaga ODA invaded Takashima County in 1572, Nobuzumi ODA governed the county, and the Omizo-jo Castle was built according to the nawabari (castle plan; general term for the layout of a castle and its component structures) developed by Mitsuhide AKECHI in 1579.

sen.j: 天正10年（1582年）本能寺の変で信澄は明智光秀の娘を正室にしていたことから、大坂で殺害されてしまった。
sen.e: When the Honnoji Incident occurred in 1582, Nobuzumi was killed in Osaka because his lawful wife was a daughter of Mitsuhide AKECHI.
When the Honnoji Incident occurred in 1582, Nobuzumi was killed in Osaka because his lawful wife was a daughter of Mitsuhide AKECHI.
When the Honnoji Incident occurred in 1582, Nobuzumi was killed in Osaka because his lawful wife was a daughter of Mitsuhide AKECHI.

sen.j: 信澄の後には、丹羽長秀・加藤光泰・生駒親正・京極高次と目まぐるしく城主が替わったが、京極高次が近江八幡へ転封となった後は無城主となっていた。
sen.e: After Nobuzumi, the lord of the castle changed constantly from Nagahide NIWA, Mitsuyasu KATO, Chikamasa IKOMA, to Takatsugu KYOGOKU, but the castle had no lords after Takatsugu KYOGOKU was relocated to Omi Hachiman.

After Nobuzumi, the lord of the castle changed constantly from Nagahide NIWA, Mitsuyasu KATO, Chikamasa IKOMA, to Takatsugu KYOGOKU, but the castle had no lords after Takatsugu KYOGOKU was relocated to Omi Hachiman.

After Nobuzumi, the lord of the castle changed constantly from Nagahide NIWA, Mitsuyasu KATO, Chikamasa IKOMA, to Takatsugu KYOGOKU, but the castle had no lords after Takatsugu KYOGOKU was relocated to Omi Hachiman.

sen.j: 元和 (日本)5年（1619年）分部光信が伊勢国伊勢上野藩より2万石で入封した。
sen.e: In 1619, Mitsunobu WAKEBE entered the domain from Ise-Ueno Domain, Ise province, and was granted 20,000 koku (the unit showing the annual yield of rice).
In 1619, Mitsunobu WAKEBE entered the Ise-Ueno Domain, Ise province, being granted 20,000 koku (the unit showing the annual yield of rice).
sen.cmt: domain from を削除しました。and was→being と修正しました。
sen.e: In 1619, Mitsunobu WAKEBE entered the Ise-Ueno Domain, Ise province, being granted 20,000 koku (the unit showing the annual yield of rice).

sen.j: しかし、元和の一国一城令の対象となり、三の丸を残して大溝城を破壊してしまった。
sen.e: But the domain was covered by the Ikkoku Ichijo Rei (Law of One Castle per Province) issued in Genna era, and the Omizo-jo Castle was destroyed except for its Sannomaru.
But the domain was covered by the Ikkoku Ichijo Rei (Law of One Castle per Province) issued in Genna era, and the Omizo-jo Castle was destroyed except for its Sannomaru.
But the domain was covered by the Ikkoku Ichijo Rei (Law of One Castle per Province) issued in Genna era, and the Omizo-jo Castle was destroyed except for its Sannomaru.

sen.j: 分部氏は三の丸に陣屋を構え、11代続き明治維新を迎えた。
sen.e: The Wakebe clan set up a jinya (regional government office) at the Sannomaru, and the clan lasted for eleven generations until after the Meiji Restoration.
The Wakebe clan set up the jinya (regional government office) at the Sannomaru, and the clan lasted for 11 generations to enter the Meiji Restoration.
sen.cmt: a→the,eleven→11,until after→to enter と修正しました。
sen.e: The Wakebe clan set up the jinya (regional government office) at the Sannomaru, and the clan lasted for 11 generations to enter the Meiji Restoration.

sen.j: 遺構として三の丸に建てられた陣屋の長屋門がある。
sen.e: Structural remnants include the Nagaya-mon gate of the jinya built on the site of Sannomaru.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Structural remnants include the Nagaya-mon gate of the jinya built on the site of Sannomaru.
Structural remnants include the Nagaya-mon gate of the jinya built on the site of Sannomaru.

sen.j: 扉がないものの宝暦5年（1755年）大改修を施し、現存し、現在民家として使われているが、近年高島市が買い上げた。
sen.e: Although the doors are missing, it was thoroughly reformed in 1755, and still exists today as a private house, but recently it was purchased by Takashima City.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Although the doors are missing, it was thoroughly reformed in 1755, and still exists today as a private house, recently it was purchased by Takashima City.
Although the doors are missing, it was thoroughly reformed in 1755, and still exists today as a private house, recently it was purchased by Takashima City.

sen.j: なお、高島市指定文化財に指定されている。
sen.e: It is a city designated cultural property of Takashima City.
It is a designated cultural property of Takashima City.
It is a designated cultural property of Takashima City.
